private_information: My role is to audit temporal and causal consistency across agent models and to remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties.
I specialize in detecting contradictions, identifying missing causal links, and recommending deterministic corrections that preserve executable semantics.
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that identifies inconsistencies between planner models, highlights bookkeeping shortcuts, and recommends concrete fixes for integration.

private_information: I integrate partial models and the auditor report and produce a single coherent PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.
I must keep distinct agent actions labeled to preserve multi-agent provenance when necessary and resolve naming mismatches.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownwards solver that achieves the global goal next object_8 object_6.

public_information: Objects: object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3 object_4 object_5 object_6 object_7 object_8.
Actions available: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.

Action paltry takes three parameters object_0 object_1 object_2 and requires facts hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, and next object_1 object_2. Performing paltry makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes vase object_0 object_1 false.

Action sip takes three parameters object_0 object_1 object_2 and requires facts hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, and next object_1 object_2. Performing sip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and makes next object_0 object_2 false.

Action clip takes three parameters object_0 object_1 object_2 and requires facts hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, and next object_0 object_2. Performing clip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and makes next object_0 object_2 false.

Action wretched takes four parameters object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3 and requires facts sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, and collect object_2 object_3. Performing wretched makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes next object_0 object_1 false.

Action memory takes three parameters object_0 object_1 object_2 and requires facts cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, and next object_0 object_1. Performing memory makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes next object_0 object_1 false.

Action tightfisted takes three parameters object_0 object_1 object_2 and requires facts hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, and vase object_0 object_1. Performing tightfisted makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes vase object_0 object_1 false.
Two alternate initial statements were provided to different planners that differ only in some next facts; the global goal is next object_8 object_6.

model.system_prompt: You are a planning domain analyst. Produce a concise structured representation of action schemas in JSON specifying for each action: name, parameters, preconditions, positive effects, negative effects, and any assumptions you must make due to missing information. Do not emit full PDDL. Identify ambiguous object references and name mismatches. Reason step by step.
model.prompt: Your name is planner1. Use the public information in environment->public_information and your private information planner1->private_information to extract action schemas and the initial facts you know. Your objective is to output a structured model that helps build a PDDL domain. List action signatures, preconditions, effects, and initial state facts from your local statement. If information is missing do not invent world facts, instead mark assumptions explicitly.

model.system_prompt: You are a planning domain analyst. Produce a concise structured representation of action schemas in JSON specifying for each action: name, parameters, preconditions, positive effects, negative effects, and any assumptions you must make due to missing information. Do not emit full PDDL. Identify ambiguous object references and name mismatches. Reason step by step.
model.prompt: Your name is planner2. Use the public information in environment->public_information and your private information planner2->private_information to extract action schemas and the initial facts you know. Your objective is to output a structured model that helps build a PDDL domain. List action signatures, preconditions, effects, and initial state facts from your local statement. If information is missing do not invent world facts, instead mark assumptions explicitly.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor specialised in temporal and causal consistency for planning models. Compare the provided structured models, detect contradictions, temporal inconsistencies, and bookkeeping shortcuts such as ephemeral quota tokens or post-hoc penalties. Provide a corrective report that lists concrete edits to preconditions/effects and initial facts to make the combined model consistent and deterministic. Output a structured report in JSON that the orchestrator can consume.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You will receive two structured models: {model_planner1} and {model_planner2}. Identify mismatches in initial facts, inconsistent use of predicates such as next and vase, potential cycles, and any bookkeeping shortcuts. Provide explicit edits and rationale. Prioritize minimal, deterministic fixes that enable integration.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the structured models and the auditor report into a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting FastDownwards. Keep agent-origin actions distinct if useful by prefixing action names with their agent provenance. Use only PDDL features supported by FastDownwards (STRIPS and ADL when appropriate) and avoid planner-specific extensions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the problem is solvable given the corrected initial facts and the global goal next object_8 object_6.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Use the public information environment->public_information, the two models {model_planner1} and {model_planner2}, and the audit report {audit_report}. Resolve naming mismatches, apply the auditor's corrections, and produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards. Keep actions distinct per agent when appropriate. Provide both domain and problem in your output enclosed by <domain> and <problem> tags respectively. Explain minimal assumptions you made in comments inside PDDL as semantically neutral comments.
